column12: The first page of their consent section is about the app itself and also asks if they want to send anonymous crash reports. Then the study consent will show. Text with few formattings supported. And they have "Participant has to sign informed consent with his signature." setting which asks the participants to sign with their finger signature.

column4:
Mid-Study Consent

This is referred to the process where the study protocol changes in the middle,
and the researcher has to send an additional consent form to participants to
sign before they continue on the modifed protocol.
column12: Although you won't be able to publish all changes at once (like a study version). If you change the protocol and save, and then the participant syncs before you get to updating the consent, the participant would see the old consent.

This is necessary to send messages to the participant and download the app. Disable the Gmail sync to prevent mail notifications.

column10: While it doesn't exactly show notifications status, it is recognizable that push notifications aren't being delivered. If you select "View Activity" for a participant, a large number of "app_launched" events indicate that the app is frequently being forced closed. You should tell the participant not to force close the app to avoid the system being unable to deliver survey notifications.

column4: Show notifications scheduled in the future

column12: Via "Alarm" sampling node.
Via "Alarm" sampling node.
Via "Alarm" sampling node.

WIP: Via "Button Pressed" sampling node. You can adjust label and order (the order of the buttons on the home screen). The higher the order/weight, the deeper it sinks. Also, you can set it as a one-time button. And you can define groups for buttons using             Button Group (on request). Groups can be minimized.

Called "Incomplete" or "Timed out". Via "Timeout Interval" property of Form sample node (after how many seconds of inactivity a timeout warning will be shown). You can set it for each form TL. Also, you can set length of the timeout alarm in seconds for each form TL. The alarm will trigger whether the form is open or not.

column4: Time-based Activity Triggering - Support for relative and absolute time
column12: For the relative part (registration date only), you can use "Sampling Day" combined with other sampling nodes.

column4: Time-based Activity Triggering - Support for exact time vs. random within a time-window
column12: For the random part, only the time (HH:mm) is supported. This event fires randomly a specified number of prompts in the specified time period and triggers the successor nodes. It also supports a Minimum Time Between Prompts. And you can specify the period using mutable values. The random time trigger follows a stratified randomization instead of allowing random prompts at any possible time. It takes the set time frame and divides it equally to accommodate the number of required prompts. Itâ€™s within these smaller chunks that the random prompt appears, only governed by the minimum time between prompts.

column4: Time-based Activity Triggering - Repeat logic (e.g. repeat daily, weekly, monthly, etc.)
column12: They have these sampling nodes: Weekday, Date Range, Time Range, Initial (fires only once after the previous node is true), Repeated (via defined interval and as long as the previous condition stays true

column4: Trigger activity based on time chosen by the participant (e.g. using a previous calendar question)
column12: Only on the time part (HH:mm) using "Time Range" sampling or "Participant Time Trigger" (on request, which allows you to repeat everday too) node.

column4: Trigger activity based on another event from the current participant (e.g. survey completed)
column12: You can define Mutable Values after a form completion and use that value as a condition in triggering another form combined with "Immediatly" sampling node. Also, you can use "Delay" sampling node to delay triggering the next form or action.

column4: Trigger activity based on another event from another participant
Create one-off sessions one at a time.

column12: On request. Called "Nearby Devices Condition"; a sampling node. It uses IBeacon standard. Also, lets you specifiy Broadcast Signal (toggle), Scanning Interval, and Time Between Scans.

On request. Via "Geofence Trigger" or "Multi Geofence Trigger". This event fires if a given geofence or any of the given geofences was entered/left or the participant is staying in it over some time. Other then the geofence itself, you can specify whether the geofence should trigger the initial location of the participant dependent on the geofence.
For sections/questions, it's called "Visibility Rule". For sampling, it's a Check Mutable Value (on request).

column4: Support for creating new variables and exporting them to be used within the study flow
column12: You can create them via (I guess) "Mutable Value Editor" (on request) and "Change Mutable Value" sampling node dynamically. Regarding the latter option, I'm not sure whether this means question responses linked to mutable values will be affected or not. You can set, increment, or decrement.

column12: Using "Play Audio" Output item inside a Multi-Item Screen. Also, you can specify whether scrubbing (changing time in audio) is allowed: And the audio can have a headline.

Using "Display Image" Output item inside a Multi-Item Screen. And the image can have a headline. On their Pricing page, they say "Items which generate an answer inside your results will count as one credit (e.g. Display Image)".
On request. Using "Display Video" Output item inside a Multi-Item Screen. It displays a Video from SD-Card. Also, you can specify whether it should auto-start.

column12: Called "Label". You will see them as a column header in your downloaded results table. Labels must start with a letter and can only consist of letters, numbers, "-", and "_". Labels are unique within the whole study.
In some item formats (e.g. Visual Analog Scale) a default value is present. In this case the required field will be ignored.

column4:
Ability to show participant's responses as part of the survey flow

This allows the survey to have a "question", or "item", that presents
 participant's past responses. For example, after the 5th question of
the survey, the researcher can show a list of all responses
participant has provided to a previous question.
Ability to show visualizations of participant's past responses as part of the survey flow

The values can be: Ignored = Participant did not respond to the alarm, Dismissed = Participant dismissed the alarm, Incomplete = Participant did not complete the form, Canceled_by_new_alarm = A new alarm canceled the previous alarm

column12: 256 Bit encrypted data transfer on all data channels (between smartphone/browser and server).

256 Bit encrypted data storage on the smartphone. Decryption of the data will happen only on the server. If a smartphone is lost by the participant, the data collected cannot be decrypted by a third person.

column10: 2FA is mandatory for all Metricwire Research Accounts.

column12: at least 8 characters length and maximum 64 characters length, at least 1 upper case letter, at least 1 lower case letter, at least 1 special character

column12: On request. Called "Location" and it uses GPS, WLAN and Cell to balance the battery usage with precision.

On request. Called "Physical Activity". You can specify the minimal interval to log the physical activity, but activity may be logged more often, if requested by other apps. They suggest a dedicated activity sensor like their own Move4 to accurately measure it.

On request. You can also limit the logs to specific apps. Just logs the app identifier.
